intro: Wahlenbergia subfusiformis var. involuta, commonly known as the spiral bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking spiral-shaped inflorescence. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is somewhat rare in the wild.
